intro: Hypocalymma oxycoccoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
